column4: i'm looking at a sight that says to use the command #apt-get update but it doesn't seem to do anything on the terminal. there's another #apt-get install smbfs smbclient that also doesn't seem to do anything.... am i doing something wrong?
apt is used to install software. apt-get update will update your local database of files availible. apt-get install <package name> will install a perticular package.
You can use Synaptic or Applications > Add/remove to install software as well.
